title: Kali 1.1.0 armhf for Raspberry PI 2
description:
This is the Kali linux image for Raspberry Pi 2.
I only take the credit for the actual building of this image.
The instructions were provided to me by http://www.procheckup.com/blog/installing-kali-linux-110-on-the-raspberry-pi-2-(model-b-1gb).aspx
This image can be "burned" using dd or Win32DiskImager to a microSD card, then you will need to follow the instructions in the chapter Configuring  Kali Linux on the Raspberry Pi 2

To save you the search:

1. "Burn" this using dd or Win32DiskImager to a microSD card.
2. Insert the card into you Raspberry Pi 2 (this will not work with any other previous version of Raspberry Pi)
3. Start Kali
4. Login using root/toor
5. Execute "/scripts/rpi-wiggle.sh" and reboot
6. Do a "apt-get update; apt-get install kali-linux-full"
7. Congratulate yourself!
